H0.text: The location of the nearest ocean is the factor that has the greatest effect on a community's stores of freshwater.

H1.text: The average annual rainfall is the factor that has the greatest effect on a community's stores of freshwater.

H2.text: The location of the nearest mountain is the factor that has the greatest effect on a community's stores of freshwater.

H3.text: The average winter temperature is the factor that has the greatest effect on a community's stores of freshwater.

A4.text: Approximately 505,000 cubic kilometres (121,000 mi3) of water falls as precipitation each year: 398,000 cubic kilometres (95,000 mi3) over oceans and 107,000 cubic kilometres (26,000 mi3) over land.

A5.text: The average annual precipitation is 990 millimetres (39 in), but over land it is only 715 millimetres (28.1 in).

A6.text: Research has shown that global warming is causing shifts in precipitation patterns, increased frequency of extreme weather events, and changes in the timing and intensity of rainfall.
